diginodehelp1.title: DigiFact Tip!
diginodehelp1.content: Some of these DigiFacts include a website URL which can be difficult to open from the terminal. To open a link, try holding the "Cmd" key on Mac or the "Ctrl" key on Windows as you click on it. Try it now: $DGNT_WEBSITE_URL

diginodehelp2.title: Need Help with DigiNode Tools?
diginodehelp2.content: Please join the DigiNode Tools Telegram group here: $SOCIAL_TELEGRAM_URL. You can also contact $SOCIAL_BLUESKY_HANDLE on Bluesky.

diginodehelp3.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp3.content: To view a global map of DigiByte Nodes, visit this website: https://opennodes.digibyte.link/

diginodehelp4.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp4.content: To view a global map of DigiAsset Nodes, visit this website: https://ipfs.digiassetx.com

diginodehelp5.title: Need DigiAsset Support?
diginodehelp5.content: For help with creating DigiAssets, a good place to start is the DigiAssetX Telegram group here: https://t.me/digiassetX

diginodehelp6.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp6.content: Are you having issues with DigiNode Dashboard? No colors? Flickering display? Misalligned borders? This is likely caused by the Terminal software you are using. For best results, use Windows Terminal (https://aka.ms/terminal) or iTerm 2 on macOS (https://iterm2.com).

diginodehelp7.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp7.content: Are you interested to know what new features have been added to DigiNode Tools recently? You can view the release notes here: https://diginode.tools/release-notes/

diginodehelp8.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp8.content: Do you also run a DigiByte node on your Mac or Windows PC? If so, you can test it using the same DigiByte port tester built into the DigiNode Dashboard. Find it here: https://diginode.tools/digibyte-port-tester/

diginodehelp8.title: DigiNode Tip!
diginodehelp8.content: DigiNode tolls is very adaptable. You can use it to setup and monitor a DigiNode on a Raspberry Pi in your home, as well as on a server on the other side of the world.
